Research Centre Introduction of New Energy Vehicle Electronic Product Testing Center Electronic Information Material Reliability Testing Center R&D Center for the Application of Modern Printing and Packaging Standardization Technology Collaborative Innovation Center of New Information Software Quality and System Security Testing Center Introduction: The Institute of IoT is an independent research institution established by Shenzhen Polytechnic University, with scientific research platforms such as "Research Center for Industrial IoT Engineering Technology" granted by the Department of Science and Technology of Guangdong Province, "Laboratory for Industrial IoT Control Technology Engineering" granted by Guangdong Provincial Development and Reform Commission, "Collaborative Innovation Center of Internet of Things Application Technology" granted by the Ministry of Education of the PRC, and "Laboratory of Industrial IoT Heterogeneous Network Control Technology Engineering" granted by the Development and Reform Commission of Shenzhen Municipality. The Institute owns high-end research equipment of tens of millions of RMB. Currently, the Institute of IoT is conducting research in the following areas: ( 1 ) Industrial Internet of Things/Industrial Internet The research in this area includes the interconnection of industrial production equipment, identification and positioning of people and goods, energy-saving control and automatic energy consumption detection, production equipment status detection and fault call, remote notification of important information at production sites, industrial emission reduction, and environmental monitoring, and other common key technologies generated by various demands. ( 2 ) Industrial AI Technology Through the use of artificial intelligence technologies such as machine vision, speech recognition, data mining, and deep learning, industrial AI application research is carried out, including equipment fault diagnosis and preventive maintenance, product defect detection, product identification and positioning, production safety early warning, and visual guidance. ( 3 ) Wearable Technology By using wearable devices combined with AR/MR and other technologies, industrial site inspection, equipment maintenance guidance, intelligent control of equipment, and other application studies have been carried out. The Institute of IoT is an independent research institution established by Shenzhen Polytechnic University, with scientific research platforms such as "Research Center for Industrial IoT Engineering Technology" granted by the Department of Science and Technology of Guangdong Province, "Laboratory for Industrial IoT Control Technology Engineering" granted by Guangdong Provincial Development and Reform Commission, "Collaborative Innovation Center of Internet of Things Application Technology" granted by the Ministry of Education of the PRC, and "Laboratory of Industrial IoT Heterogeneous Network Control Technology Engineering" granted by the Development and Reform Commission of Shenzhen Municipality. The Institute owns high-end research equipment of tens of millions of RMB. Currently, the Institute of IoT is conducting research in the following areas: ( 1 ) Industrial Internet of Things/Industrial Internet The research in this area includes the interconnection of industrial production equipment, identification and positioning of people and goods, energy-saving control and automatic energy consumption detection, production equipment status detection and fault call, remote notification of important information at production sites, industrial emission reduction, and environmental monitoring, and other common key technologies generated by various demands. ( 3 ) Wearable Technology By using wearable devices combined with AR/MR and other technologies, industrial site inspection, equipment maintenance guidance, intelligent control of equipment, and other application studies have been carried out. Packaging Standardization Technology Collaborative Innovation Center of New Information Software Quality and System Security Testing Center The Institute of Intelligence Science and Engineering of Shenzhen Polytechnic University, also the Joint Laboratory of State Key Laboratory of Industrial Control Technology and Shenzhen Polytechnic University, jointly built by Shenzhen Polytechnic University and State Key Laboratory of Industrial Control Technology, was officially established on April 28, 2018. It is a high-level scientific research institution specializing in core key theoretical research and technology R&D and application in the field of intelligent science and engineering. As an important part of the basic science and applied technology innovation system of Shenzhen Polytechnic University, the Institute of Intelligence Science and Engineering, relying on the talent reserve and research foundation of the State Key Laboratory of Industrial Control Technology of Zhejiang University in the field of control science and engineering, and focusing on "intelligence +", makes full use of the geographical advantages of being located in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area. With the help of Shenzhen's superior industrial strategic layout and solid industrial foundation, we are trying to build an innovation platform integrating basic science, applied technology research, engineering development, achievement transfer, and talent training. The Institute consists of the Research Laboratory of Intelligent Motor Body, the Research Laboratory for Intelligent Decision-making in Manufacturing Processes, the Research Laboratory for the Frontiers of Intelligent Science Fundamentals, the Standardization Research Center, the Achievement Transformation and Industrialization Center, and the Multi-functional Office. With the major national demands such as "Artificial Intelligence 2.0" and "Smart Manufacturing 2025" in mind, the Institute has conducted research on frontier scientific problems and engineering application challenges of intelligent systems and has made several breakthroughs in the fields of intelligent system optimization and control and big-data-driven industrial intelligence. The research is mainly focused on the following areas: (1) Dynamic wireless charging sets and technologies for electric vehicles; (2) Energy intelligent management software and hardware system for new energy vehicles; (3) Heterogeneous collaboration and control systems for air/ground robots; (4) Human-machine cooperative manufacturing process planning and scheduling decision and mutual learning systems under uncertain and open environment; (5) Intelligent maintenance and self-healing systems and technologies for control performance in manufacturing processes; (6) Intelligent system automation and integration international and national standards development; (7) V2x-based vehicle-road cooperative intelligent driving system and technology; (8) Application of artificial intelligence and image recognition in medical diagnosis; (9) Control and optimal operation technology for smart factories. Software Quality and System Security Testing Center I. Profile The Elderly Healthcare Research Institute is a school-level research platform of Shenzhen Polytechnic University. Making full use of the excellent research resources of Shenzhen Polytechnic University, it focuses on the research of the elderly care industry and related policies, elderly care standards, and elderly care education. There are currently 12 full-time researchers at the Institute, including six with a doctorate and three with senior titles, as well as five academic advisors. Since its establishment in 2019, the Institute has provided decision-making advisory services to government departments on over 80 occasions, including to the Shenzhen Decision-making Advisory Committee, Bureau of Civil Affairs of Shenzhen Municipality, Development and Reform Commission of Shenzhen Municipality, Bureau of Retired Veteran Cadres of Shenzhen Municipality, People's Congress of Shenzhen Municipality, CPPCC Shenzhen Municipal Committee, Healthcare Security Bureau of Shenzhen Municipality, Bureau of Human Resources and Social Security of Shenzhen Municipality, and Xiong'an New Area in Hebei. One of the Institute's research reports received the Excellent Achievement Award of the Ministry of Civil Affairs of China, and the results from three research projects have been adopted by the Shenzhen Municipal People's Government's policy documents. The Institute also prepared the 14th Five-Year Plan of six district-level civil affairs departments, all of which were released by the respective governments. The Institute has provided industrial advisory services for large central and state-owned enterprises such as China Resources Land, Ping An Smart City, China Merchants Shekou Industrial Zone Holdings Co., Ltd., and Shenzhen Expressway. It has been praised by the Office of the National Working Commission on Aging as "a think tank that finds solutions for governments and businesses". Two of the Institute's studies — Study on the Innovative Practice of Elderly Education in Shenzhen and Shenzhen Blue Book on Elderly Care Services—2021 Report on Development of Elderly Care Services in Shenzhen — have been published by the Social Sciences Academic Press. It has compiled two academic journals, namely the Elderly Care Journal and the Evergreen Journal . II. Exemplary Projects 1. Policy research: The Institute presided over the preparation of the Regulations on Elderly Care Services in Shenzhen Special Economic Zone , Implementation Plan for Building a High-Level '1336' Elderly Care Service System (2021-2025) , Decision on Building a High-level Elderly Care Service System , and Opinions on the Implementation of Long-term Care Insurance in Shenzhen , all of which were released by the Shenzhen government or relevant departments, making significant contributions to the top-level design of elderly care services in Shenzhen. 2. Standards formulation: The Institute has developed three local standards for the Shenzhen government and formulated 120 elderly care service standards. It has also put together the Elderly Care Standard System of Shenzhen , which was published by the Bureau of Civil Affairs of Shenzhen Municipality. 3. Projects in 2021: The Institute undertook nine municipal policy advisory projects and three industrial advisory projects in 2021. 2 021 1 Research on Building a High-level and Multi-layered Elderly Care Service System CPPCC Shenzhen Municipal Committee Municipal-level In progress 2 Development of Shenzhen Elderly Care Standard System Bureau of Civil Affairs of Shenzhen Municipality Municipal-level In progress 3 Evaluation on Reform of Operation and Management Models of Nursing Homes in Shenzhen Bureau of Civil Affairs of Shenzhen Municipality Municipal-level In progress 4 Research on the Modern Aging Society from the Perspective of Serving Retired Cadres Bureau of Civil Affairs of Shenzhen Municipality Municipal-level In progress 5 Evaluation on Performance of Publicly Built and Privately Operated Elderly Care Institutions and PPP Projects in Shenzhen Bureau of Civil Affairs of Shenzhen Municipality Municipal-level In progress 6 Research on the Optimal Allocation of Resources for Urban Community-based Elderly Care Services Shenzhen Decision-making Advisory Committee Municipal-level In progress 7 Special Research on Urban Elderly Care in Shenzhen Development and Reform Commission of Shenzhen Municipality Municipal-level In progress 8 Special Research on Vulnerable Groups Development and Reform Commission of Shenzhen Municipality Municipal-level In progress 9 Research Report on Integration of Healthcare and Elderly Care in Pingshan District Social Construction Committee of Pingshan District People's Congress District-level In progress 1 Report on the Development of the Healthcare Industry in the Greater Bay Area Yuejian Group 2021 In progress 2 Research Report on China Merchants Health "Property + Elderly Care" Business Model China Merchants Landmark (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd. 2021 In progress 3 Counseling on Elderly Care Industry Layout of Baoxing Hospital Baoxing Hospital 2021 In progress III. Construction of a Provincial-level Platform The Institute is active in research of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area, where it has carried out tracking studies on the aging trend, investigated the distribution and allocation of elderly care service resources, and created a model for the allocation of elderly service resources in cities in the area. In addition, it publishes the Greater Bay Area Healthcare Resource Allocation Index and Healthcare Industry White Paper on a yearly basis, providing rationales for policy and business decisions. The Institute has also held healthcare summit forums, pooling outstanding experts inside and outside China to explore the path of dealing with the aging population problem in the Greater Bay Area. In the next three to five years, the Institute will work vigorously to develop the Greater Bay Area Healthcare Data Research Center, Greater Bay Area Healthcare Resource Allocation Index, Greater Bay Area Healthcare Industry White Paper, and Greater Bay Area Healthcare Industry Summit, thus building itself into an important platform for healthcare research and application in the Greater Bay Area and China, as well as a think tank for healthcare research in southern China. It will bring together and train experts in the healthcare industry, contributing wisdom to the national strategy dealing with the aging population problem.
